Legal_Issue: Did the IAD make erroneous findings of fact in a perverse or capricious manner, disregarding material evidence?
Outcome: Application allowed, decision quashed, matter referred back for reconsideration
Credibility_Assessment: Findings on credibility lacked sufficient evidence
Evidence_Type: Material evidence regarding marriage genuineness, compatibility, independent inquiries
Legal_Provision: s 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Unreasonable findings by IAD in spousal sponsorship refusal
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Haste of marriage, lack of compatibility, insufficient independent inquiries
Application_Error: Erroneous, capricious, or perverse findings disregarding material evidence
Review_Outcome: Decision found deficient, remitted to differently constituted IAD
Assessment_Standard: Justification, transparency, and intelligibility of decision
Evidence_Ignored: Material evidence supporting genuineness of marriage
Decision_Outcome: Initial refusal of spousal sponsorship appeal
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient basis for credibility and compatibility findings
Procedural_Fairness: Potential breach due to disregard of material evidence
Credibility_Issues: Assessed but found lacking evidentiary support
